0.title: Bhagwant Mann meets Punjab Governor, stakes claim to form next govt in state
0.article_body: Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann met state Governor Banwarilal Purohit at the Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh on Saturday and staked claim to form the next government in the state. Mann said the swearing-in ceremony will be held at Bhagat Singh's native village Khatkar Kalan at 12.30 pm on March 16. "Punjabis from all over the state will come," Mann added.

1.title: India sees lowest one-day rise in COVID cases since May 12, 2020 as 3,614 test positive
1.article_body: India has reported 3,614 new COVID-19 cases and 89 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It is the lowest single-day rise in COVID-19 cases the country has seen since May 12, 2020. India's active caseload stands at 40,559, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,803.

2.title: Rare 250-kg carpenter shark caught in Karnataka, pics surface
2.article_body: A rare and endangered species of sawfish or carpenter shark has been caught off coast in Karnataka's Malpe. The shark weighed around 250 kg. It was caught by a fishermen boat and was shifted from the boat to a truck with the help of crane. It is a protected species in India under Schedule I of Wildlife Protection Act 1972.

3.title: BITS grads-led US-based startup Birdeye raises $60 million
3.article_body: US-based customer experience tech startup Birdeye has raised $60 million in a Series C funding round led by Accel-KKR. Founded by BITS Pilani graduates, Naveen Gupta and Neeraj Gupta, Birdeye claims to help over 80,000 local businesses manage customer experience and interactions. The platform has raised a total of $93 million over three funding rounds to date, as per Crunchbase.

4.title: US imposes sanctions on Putin spokesperson's family
4.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov's family. Peskov's wife and his children lead "luxurious lifestyles that are incongruous with his civil servant salary and are likely built on the ill-gotten wealth of his connections to Putin", US Treasury Department said. Peskov's daughter Elizaveta Peskova had publicly opposed Russia's attack on Ukraine.

5.title: One of world's best snipers 'Wali' fighting Russian forces in Ukraine
5.article_body: One of the world's best snipers, nicknamed 'Wali', is fighting Russian forces in Ukraine. The French-Canadian computer scientist, who can provide 40 kills in a day, has served twice in the Afghanistan war between 2009 and 2011. He earned the name 'Wali', which means protector in Arabic, during his stint in Afghanistan.

6.title: Russia using unguided 'dumb' bombs in Ukraine: UK
6.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry has said that Russian aircraft supporting ground offensive in Ukraine are primarily using unguided "dumb" bombs. "Such weapons are relatively inaccurate and indiscriminate and their use significantly increases the likelihood of civilian casualties," the ministry added. British Intelligence said Russia carried out strikes on cities of Lutsk and Ivano-Frankivsk.

7.title: Sitharaman stresses on need for multilateral action amid rising global inflation
7.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke to International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva and stressed on the need for multilateral action amid rising prices of commodities due to global supply chain disruptions. According to the Finance Ministry, Sitharaman and Georgieva suggested that the key question remains on the control of inflation while balancing needs for growth.

8.title: I got some criticism: Sai Tamhankar on wearing bikini on screen
8.article_body: Actress Sai Tamhankar has said when she wore a bikini, the Marathi fraternity welcomed the gesture with open arms. "I also got some criticism. Something which I'm comfortable with, my family is comfortable with," she added. "I like characters of all shades. I mean, why portray, only whites, or only blacks, I think our whole life is in-between," Sai said.

9.title: Actress Shama Sikander shares pictures from her bachelorette party
9.article_body: Ahead of her wedding with James Milliron, actress Shama Sikander shared a few pictures from her bachelorette party on her Instagram handle. "Finally getting the Bridal vibes. What a beautiful bachelorette. Thank you all my lovely bridesmaids you all made my day," she wrote. Shama is set to tie the knot with James Milliron in Goa on March 14.

10.title: SC seeks Centre's response on pharmaceutical firms giving freebies
10.article_body: Supreme Court has sought the Centre's response on a plea to regulate pharmaceutical firms bribing doctors with freebies for prescribing their drugs. The advocate who filed the plea said that doctors' licenses are cancelled for such misconduct while it's "actuated, encouraged, aided and abetted" by pharmaceutical firms. The plea has sought that pharmaceutical firms should be held equally liable.

11.title: 2 boys feared drowned in Sutlej river in Himachal's Shimla; search op underway
11.article_body: Two boys, both aged 14, are feared drowned in Sutlej river in the Khaneri area of Himachal Pradesh's Shimla district, officials said. The children were reportedly playing on the banks of the river and had stepped into the river to get their ball back. Police and National Disaster Response Force have launched a search and rescue operation after receiving information.

12.title: Centre introducing regressive ideas in syllabus: MK Stalin
12.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that the Centre is using its power to introduce "regressive ideas" in the syllabus of universities and this was a "worrisome development". He said that as Education comes under the Concurrent List, the Centre is misusing its power, adding that the best solution for this issue was to restore Education to the State List.

13.title: 1 dead, 1 injured after BMW car hits them in Delhi's Kalayanpuri
13.article_body: Two men were hit by a BMW car in the Kalayanpuri area on Friday night, Delhi Police said. "One was brought dead to the hospital...another was injured...shifted to LBS hospital," police added. An FIR has been filed in the matter, Delhi Police stated. Earlier, two people died after a car rammed into a truck on the Palam flyover in February.

14.title: People caught littering in Chandigarh to be fined up to ₹10,000
14.article_body: People who are found dumping waste in the open in Chandigarh will be fined up to ₹10,000, the municipal corporation said. The corporation has identified 48 garbage vulnerable points across Chandigarh and put up boards warning people. Those found burning garbage and dumping malba at these sites will be fined ₹5,000 each and those found littering will be fined ₹500.

15.title: It was a regular middle-class wedding: Vikrant on marriage with Sheetal
15.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey in an interview opened up about his marriage with actress Sheetal Thakur and said that it was a "regular middle-class wedding". Talking about his life post marriage with Sheetal, the actor said that it has been beautiful so far and he wishes to spend more time with his wife. Vikrant and Sheetal got married on February 18.

16.title: Committed to safety of Bengalureans: Police chief after Namma 112 praised
16.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday thanked a news agency's editor after he tweeted that he can "vouch" for the police helpline Namma 112. "Had a run-in with a bad actor...on airport road...Culprit was detained in under 15 mins," the news agency's editor had said. "Bengaluru City Police is committed to the safety of Namma Bengalureans!" Pant said.

17.title: What are the highest individual scores in Day-Night Test cricket?
17.article_body: Australia's David Warner holds the record for the highest individual score in Day-Night Tests with 335*(418) against Pakistan in Adelaide in 2019. He's followed by Pakistan's Azhar Ali, who scored 302*(469) against West Indies in Dubai in 2016. Ex-England captain Alastair Cook's 243(407) is the third-highest score, while Virat Kohli's 136(194) is the highest Day-Night Test score among Indians.

18.title: Won't tolerate Russophobia: Meta on allowing posts seeking Putin's death
18.article_body: Meta Global Affairs President Nick Clegg in a tweet defended Meta's decision to temporarily lift a ban on posts calling for Russian President Vladimir Putin's death saying, "We have no quarrel with...Russian people...We will not tolerate Russophobia." He said the decision has been taken in "extraordinary" circumstances. Russia has asked for Meta to be designated as an "extremist organisation".

19.title: Delhi HC denies bail to Christian Michel in AgustaWestland scam case
19.article_body: Delhi High Court on Friday denied bail to the alleged middleman Christian Michel James, a British citizen, accused in the AgustaWestland scam case, being probed by CBI and ED. James was extradited from Dubai and was arrested by ED in December 2018. The AgustaWestland scam pertains to corruption and money laundering cases in the procurement of 12 VVIP choppers.

20.title: JeM commander, 3 other terrorists killed in separate encounters in J&K
20.article_body: Four terrorists, including a Jaish-e-Mohammed commander, were killed and one was arrested in separate encounters in J&K, police said on Saturday. The security forces had launched joint operations at four-five locations, IGP Kashmir Vijay Kumar said. While two Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists were killed in Pulwama, the other two hailing from Lashkar-e-Taiba were killed in Ganderbal and Handwara.

21.title: Harmanpreet Kaur becomes first Indian to smash 3 hundreds in Women's World Cup history
21.article_body: Harmanpreet Kaur has become the first Indian cricketer to smash three hundreds in the history of Women's World Cup. The 33-year-old achieved the feat by scoring 109(107) against West Indies in a 2022 Women's World Cup match today. Harmanpreet's first Women's World Cup hundred (107*) came against England in 2013 and the second (171*) came against Australia in 2017.

22.title: Pune to inaugurate its 6th human milk bank tomorrow
22.article_body: Pune city's 6th human milk bank will be inaugurated at the Bharati Vidyapeeth hospital on Sunday. According to Dr Aarti Kinikar, the milk bank will be useful for newborns admitted to neonatal intensive care units (NICUs) or in cases where mothers die or are unable to lactate. She also claimed, "As neonatal care gets better, the demand will further increase."

23.title: Man's tongue turns black, hairy in Kerala; pics surface
23.article_body: A Kerala man's tongue turned black and hairy after he was put on a pureed diet following a stroke, according to a report published in the JAMA Dermatology journal. Doctors diagnosed him with a medical condition called lingua villosa nigra or black hairy tongue. "The patient and caregivers were given advice regarding proper cleansing measures," the report said.

24.title: Goa TMC leader Mahesh Amonkar resigns, alleges 'lack of support'
24.article_body: Goa TMC's Mahesh S Amonkar resigned from the party alleging "lack of support and negligence from the designated AITC and I-PAC team" during Assembly polls. Amonkar's resignation comes a day after the Goa Assembly poll results were declared in which TMC did not win in any of the 40 seats. Amonkar contested Goa Assembly elections from the Margao constituency.

25.title: Saudi blogger jailed for 'insulting Islam' freed after 10 years
25.article_body: Saudi Arabian blogger Raif Badawi was released on Friday after a decade in prison, his wife said. Badawi, in 2014, was sentenced to 10 years in prison and 1,000 lashes for "insulting Islam" and setting up a liberal online forum. He was publicly flogged in January 2015, receiving 50 lashes, but the rest were suspended after global condemnation.

26.title: Bihar government to provide arms license to every panchayat leader
26.article_body: Bihar Panchayati Raj Minister Samrat Choudhary has said that the state government has decided to provide an arms license to every panchayat leader after many public representatives were killed following the 2021 state panchayat elections. He added that the public representatives must apply for the arms license before the DM, which will then be recommended to the Home Department.

27.title: 2 Indians score hundreds in same Women's World Cup match for the first time
27.article_body: The India-West Indies 2022 Women's World Cup match witnessed two Indian cricketers scoring hundreds in the same Women's World Cup match for the first time. Opener Smriti Mandhana smashed her fifth ODI hundred, scoring 123(119), while Harmanpreet Kaur scored 109(107) in the match. Mandhana and Harmanpreet's centuries helped India put up a total of 317/8.

28.title: India record their highest-ever total in Women's World Cup history, score 317/8
28.article_body: India have recorded their highest-ever total in Women's World Cup history by putting up a total of 317/8 against West Indies on Saturday. India's previous highest total in Women's World Cup was 284/6, which came against West Indies in Mumbai in the 2013 edition. Smriti Mandhana top-scored for India with 123(119) today, while Harmanpreet Kaur scored 109(107).

29.title: Sarpanch shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Kulgam; 3rd such killing in 10 days
29.article_body: Suspected terrorists shot dead sarpanch Shabir Ahmad Mir from Audora in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Friday. This is the third such killing in the last 10 days, police said. "The deceased was given accommodation in a secure hotel in Srinagar. He had left the hotel and reached his home without informing the police," Kashmir IGP Vijay Kumar said.

30.title: Rajkot farmer booked for growing 6,800 poppy plants worth ₹4.48 lakh
30.article_body: Rajkot Police booked a farmer for allegedly growing 6,800 poppy plants on the border of his wheat field at Bedla village. The plants weighing 149 kg have a market value of ₹4.48 lakh. "The poppy plants were at the stage of maturity...poppy balls would have been ready for extraction of opium resin in about a month's time," police said.

31.title: DM forms panel to look into last month's alleged gas leak in Noida
31.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate has formed a four-member committee to probe last month's alleged gas leak in Sectors 137, 93, 93B and 128. On the evening of February 24, several residents started complaining of a strong PNG-like gas smell around their homes. The authorities turned up to resolve but there is still no clarity on the matter.

32.title: 17-year-old boy rapes two-year-old neighbour in Mohali, arrested
32.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was arrested for allegedly raping his two-year-old neighbour in Mohali, Sector 82 on Thursday. The toddler's mother had dropped her at the teenager's home to watch cartoons. When she heard her daughter screaming she rushed back to the teen's room and found him sexually assaulting her. She took her to a hospital and informed the police.

33.title: Anupam Kher celebrates his b'day with his 'street friends', shares video
33.article_body: Anupam Kher, who turned 67 on March 7, took to Instagram to share a video where he can be seen celebrating his birthday with his "street friends". "Happy I could celebrate my belated birthday with my street friends #Darshana #Divya and #Yogesh and cut...cake with them. I feel really blessed," he wrote, with the hashtags 'friends' and 'streets of Mumbai'.

34.title: BMC issues attachment notice to Metro One for not paying taxes worth ₹300 cr
34.article_body: The BMC has issued an attachment notice to Mumbai Metro One Private Limited (MMOPL) for non-payment of property taxes worth over ₹300 crore. According to BMC, the Mumbai Metro One, which operates the Versova-Andheri-Ghatkopar Line, has not paid the taxes since 2013. However, MMOPL officials stated that they have been exempted from paying taxes by the Bombay High Court.

35.title: realme announces ₹3000 discount on realme 9 Pro+ 5G
35.article_body: realme expanded its number series portfolio featuring realme 9 Pro+ 5G and 9 Pro 5G. With the 50MP Sony IMX766 camera, epic pictures can be taken in every light and environment, realme said, adding that it is the only OIS in this price segment. It also features light shift design and 5G processors. Customers can avail discounts up to ₹3000.

36.title: Farmer protesting over Chhattisgarh new capital land acquisition dies
36.article_body: A 68-year-old farmer, who was protesting with others affected by land acquisition for Chhattisgarh's new capital city, died on Friday, officials said. "He fainted...was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead," Raipur District Magistrate Saurabh Kumar said. Farmers of 27 villages in Raipur's Nava Raipur Atal Nagar have been protesting to seek adequate rehabilitation and compensation.

37.title: Man approaches Supreme Court accusing wife of cheating, says 'She has a penis'
37.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to examine a man's plea that his wife should be criminally prosecuted for cheating as she has penis. A Supreme Court bench sought a response from the man's wife after the man provided medical report claiming she has a penis and imperforate hymen. "She is a man...It's definitely cheating," the man's lawyer NK Mody said.

38.title: Newsweek editor praises Namma 112; B'luru police chief thanks him
38.article_body:
Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday thanked Newsweek Asia Editor at Large Danish Manzoor after he tweeted that he can "vouch" for the police helpline Namma 112. "Had a run-in with a bad actor...on airport road...Culprit was detained in under 15 mins," Manzoor had said.  
"Bengaluru City Police is committed to the safety of Namma Bengalureans!" Pant also said.

39.title: Mithali Raj breaks world record for captaining in most Women's World Cup matches
39.article_body: India Women skipper Mithali Raj has broken the world record for captaining in most Women's World Cup matches. The ongoing India-West Indies' 2022 Women's World Cup match is Mithali's 24th as captain in Women's World Cup history. She went past former Australia Women captain Belinda Clark, who had captained in 23 matches.

40.title: YouTube blocks Russian state-funded media channels globally
40.article_body: YouTube is blocking access to channels associated with Russian state-funded media globally, days after it blocked channels like RT and Sputnik in Europe. It said it will remove content about Russia's invasion that deny, minimise or trivialise "well-documented violent events". "The blocking by YouTube is nothing but a new turn of an atrocious attack on...freedom of the press," Sputnik said.

41.title: Stalls on road safety, anti-drug awareness opened at Hyd's Numaish exhibition
41.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police has inaugurated various stalls on road safety awareness, SHE teams and anti-drug awareness at the city's iconic exhibition 'Numaish'. "People visiting the exhibition can have a friendly interaction with the staff available at the stalls and educate themselves with traffic rules and road safety," Police Commissioner CV Anand said.

42.title: 55-year-old man killed by elephant near Hasanur in Tamil Nadu
42.article_body: A 55-year-old man was killed by an elephant, which was in search of water, in Tamil Nadu's Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve (STR) on Friday. The person was walking along a stretch of the national highway near Hasanur when the elephant which was crossing the road came hurtling towards the old man and trampled him to death, the Hasanur Police said.

43.title: Grimes dating whistleblower Chelsea Manning after breakup with Elon Musk: Reports
43.article_body: Singer-songwriter Grimes, who recently shared that she has broken up with Tesla CEO Elon Musk, is now dating former US Army intelligence analyst and whistleblower Chelsea Manning, reports said. Earlier, Grimes revealed that she and Musk welcomed their second child via surrogacy in December. Manning was sentenced to 35 years in prison after leaking classified documents to WikiLeaks.

44.title: UN to work on safe corridor for ships stranded by Ukraine conflict
44.article_body: The UN's shipping agency said it'll seek to create a safe maritime corridor to "allow the...evacuation of seafarers, ships from...high-risk and affected areas in the Black Sea and...Sea of Azov". Russia's military took control of waterways on February 24, when it invaded Ukraine. Reportedly, the war has left about 100 foreign-flagged vessels and hundreds of mariners stranded in Ukrainian ports.

45.title: 3 held for hiring labourers who died during manual scavenging in Mumbai
45.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested three people for hiring three men who died while manually scavenging a septic tank of a public toilet in Kandivali. The trio had reportedly entered the tank to check if there was a leak after the residents complained of a foul smell. The accused, however, alleged that they had informed the BMC about the issue.

46.title: Surat farmers protest over land acquisition for railway line from Adani port
46.article_body: Hundreds of farmers gathered to protest against land acquisition for a new broad gauge goods railway track from Adani port to Gothan village and took out a rally in Surat on Friday. They also handed over a memorandum to the district collector stating that farmers of 15 villages in Olpad and Choryasi talukas will lose their lands under the project.

47.title: Centre should not mess with farmers: Meghalaya Governor Malik
47.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has warned the Centre not to "mess with farmers" and advised them to "fulfil all the promises made" to the farming community. "Farmers will get what they want, either through talks or fight. If needed, they will get violent and achieve what they want," said Malik at an event in Jodhpur on Friday.

48.title: Satellite internet sabotage amid Russia's invasion under probe: Report
48.article_body: Analysts from US NSA, the French government's ANSSI, and Ukrainian intelligence are probing a cyberattack that disrupted broadband satellite internet access in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion, Reuters reported. The satellite service started facing issues on February 24 between 5 AM-9 AM as Russia began its invasion. US-based telecommunications firm Viasat owns the affected network.

49.title: 7 die after fire breaks out in 30 shanties of Gokulpuri area in Delhi
49.article_body: At least seven people died after a fire that broke out in 30 shanties of the Gokulpuri area in Delhi, the fire service officials said. "At 1 am there was a fire incident in Gokulpuri PS area. Immediately teams reached the spot with all rescue equipment," police said. "We could douse the fire by around 4 am," police added.

50.title: Country's 1st medical city to come up in 300-acre plot in Pune rural: Ajit Pawar
50.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, while presenting the state Budget, announced the country's first medical city named 'Indrayani Medicity' will be set up in Pune rural for all kinds of specialised treatment under one roof. The state government is hoping to attract investment worth over ₹10,000 crore for this project. The 'Indrayani Medicity' will have about 24 separate hospital buildings.

51.title: Water supply to be hit in Mumbai's Dadar and Worli on March 14-15
51.article_body: Water supply will be disrupted in Mumbai's Dadar and Worli on March 14-15 between 8 am and 2 pm due to repair work on the Tansa East and West main water supply line, the BMC said. According to BMC, there will be 100% water cut in several areas including Worli, Mahalaxmi, Lower Parel, Gokhale Marg.

52.title: Maha-Metro completes metro work crossing rly lines in 5hrs in Pune
52.article_body: Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited (Maha-Metro) on Friday completed an elevated metro corridor work, crossing two railway lines, at Pune's Khadki in five hours. "Central railway had given us time between 11 am and 4 pm...and our team finished the work within deadline,"  Maha-Metro public relations officer said. Maha-Metro has constructed a 79 metre-long girder crossing the railway lines.

53.title: AAP didn't pay ₹13,000 cr to MCD, spends ₹100 cr on ads every month: Gambhir
53.article_body: BJP's Gautam Gambhir criticised the Arvind Kejriwal-led government by saying that AAP government is not giving ₹13,000 crore to MCD for paying its employees but it spends ₹100 crore every month on party's advertisements. He further said that AAP government is "lying for the last seven years". This comes after Kejriwal alleged that BJP postponed the MCD polls fearing defeat.

54.title: VK Sasikala gets bail in preferential treatment at B'luru jail case
54.article_body: A court in Bengaluru has granted bail to expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala and her sister-in-law in a case related to the alleged preferential treatment given to them at the central jail. The duo has been ordered to pay a ₹3 lakh cash bond. Sasikala was accused of getting preferential treatment in a 2017 report by a senior police official.

55.title: UK sanctions 386 Russian lawmakers who supported Putin's invasion
55.article_body: The UK has imposed sanctions on 386 members of Russia's lower house of Parliament who supported President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. The lawmakers in February voted to recognise two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent, providing a pretext for the war, British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said. The lawmakers will be subjected to a travel ban and asset freeze.

56.title: South Africa's Gibbs was hungover during world record ODI chase against Australia
56.article_body: South Africa's Herschelle Gibbs was hungover when he smashed 175 runs off 111 balls to help his team record the highest successful chase in ODI history against Australia on March 12, 2006. Gibbs admitted in his autobiography that he drank till late in the night prior to the ODI and had a "massive hangover" when he came out to bat.

57.title: Bowler never played an ODI after giving 113 runs in a match
57.article_body: Australia's Mick Lewis never played international cricket again after leaking record 113 runs in the ODI against South Africa on March 12, 2006. Playing just his seventh ODI, the pacer registered figures of 10-0-113-0 as South Africa scored 438 to record the highest-ever successful ODI chase. Herschelle Gibbs, who scored 175 in the match, was dropped twice on Lewis' bowling.

58.title: 4 men rob Iraqi couple of ₹2.44 lakh needed for surgery in Gurugram
58.article_body: Police booked four men for robbing a couple from Iraq of ₹2.44 lakh that they had brought to India for surgery in Gurugram. The suspects posed as policemen and robbed them on the pretext of checking their travel documents on Thursday, police said. The woman came to India with her husband on March 6 to undergo liver surgery, police added.

59.title: Man pretending to be Swiggy delivery boy enters house, robs family in Thane
59.article_body: A man, allegedly pretending to be a delivery boy from Swiggy, entered a house in Thane, robbed the family of valuables worth ₹10.20 lakh and threatened a 15-year-old with a knife. The accused had asked for water from the woman, who hadn't ordered any food. Police said the accused escaped with gold and diamond jewellery, cash and a mobile phone.

60.title: 400-plus target has been chased successfully only once in ODI cricket's 51-year history
60.article_body: A 400-plus target has been successfully chased only once in 4,364 men's ODIs and 51 years of ODI cricket. South Africa achieved it by chasing down Australia's 434, the first-ever 400-plus men's ODI total, at Johannesburg on March 12, 2006. The match witnessed 87 fours and 26 sixes, with both teams scoring combined 872, highest match aggregate in ODI history.

61.title: Besieged Mariupol now the worst humanitarian catastrophe: Ukraine Foreign Minister
61.article_body: Sharing a picture of a mass grave, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted, "Besieged Mariupol is now worst humanitarian catastrophe on the planet." He added, "1,582 dead civilians in 12 days, even buried in mass graves like this one." Kuleba stated, "Unable to defeat Ukrainian Army...Putin bombs the unarmed, blocks humanitarian aid. We need planes to stop Russian war crimes!"

62.title: Russian soldiers kidnap Ukrainian mayor; video surfaces
62.article_body: The mayor of southern Ukraine's Melitopol was kidnapped on Friday by Russian soldiers occupying the city, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and officials said. "A group of 10 occupiers kidnapped the mayor of Melitopol Ivan Fedorov," Ukraine's Parliament said on Twitter. "This is obviously a sign of weakness of the invaders," Zelenskyy said, comparing Russian soldiers with ISIS terrorists.

63.title: Kejriwal-led Delhi govt deprived MCDs of ₹13,000 crore: Smriti Irani
63.article_body: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani said that the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in Delhi deprived the Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs) of ₹13,000 crore as funds. "Kejriwal himself had stopped the funds for sanitation workers," she added. "He goes to such depths...he even stops fund flow for maintenance of parks in the national capital," Irani stated.

64.title: New batch for online MBA, BCOM & BBA starting soon at Manipal University
64.article_body: NAAC A+ accredited Manipal University Jaipur has announced that the new batches of its UGC-entitled online degrees like MBA, BCOM, BBA, BCA & more are starting soon. It invites students to get a degree while working or pursuing other commitments and benefit from offerings like scholarships, vast alumni network, free access to Coursera & additional professional certification courses worth ₹50,000.

65.title: UK millionaire blocks street with his Bentleys to prevent demolition of luxury complex
65.article_body: A millionaire used his Bentleys and other luxury cars to block the street leading to 'UK’s biggest man cave' to prevent it from getting demolished. Graham Wildin has been involved in a legal battle after he built a luxury complex behind his house equipped with a bowling alley, cinema, squash court and private casino in 2014 without gaining proper permission.

66.title: 30-yr-old software engineer dies on spot as truck hits him in Pune
66.article_body: A 30-year-old software engineer died on the spot after a speeding truck mowed down the bike he was riding on the stretch on Wednesday morning in Pune. The deceased man was going towards his workplace on a motorcycle when the truck dashed him near the Punjab National Bank branch in Undri, police said. Meanwhile, police have arrested the truck driver.

67.title: Man forces wife to drink phenyl for refusing to divorce; held near Mumbai
67.article_body: A man has been arrested from Panvel near Mumbai for attempting to kill his 35-year-old wife. The man was reportedly having an extramarital affair and was seeking a divorce, which his wife kept refusing. On Tuesday, he and his relatives tried to convince the woman to divorce him. However, when she didn't agree, the accused forced her to drink phenyl.

68.title: Crocodile caught & paraded by locals in MP, video goes viral
68.article_body: A crocodile that had reportedly entered a village in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri on Thursday night was caught, tied with a rope and paraded by a few youths, a video of which went viral on social media. The reptile was later put in a water tank on instructions of the village elderly before being rescued by a forest department team.

69.title: UP man held over objectionable remarks against PM Modi, CM Yogi
69.article_body: A man who was allegedly seen making objectionable remarks against PM Narendra Modi and UP CM Yogi Adityanath in a viral video during election campaigning was arrested by UP Police on Friday. He has been identified as Ajay Yadav from Azamgarh. A case under provisions of the IT Act and CLA Act has been registered against him.

70.title: Blessed to play impactful characters: Radhika Madan on upcoming projects
70.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan said she feels blessed to be playing 'impactful and important' characters in her upcoming projects. While talking about the women-driven stories that she is currently working on, the actress said, "Each role celebrates a different story of a woman." Radhika is currently working on National award-winning filmmaker Sudhanshu Saria's film 'Sanaa'.

71.title: Largest food company Nestlé stops exports of non-essential items to Russia
71.article_body: World's largest food company Nestlé has stopped exporting and importing non-essential food items from and to Russia. The company will still supply Russians with necessities such as baby food, cereal and therapeutic pet food sold at veterinarian clinics. "We are shocked and deeply saddened by the invasion of Ukraine...[It] has brought heartbreaking, unimaginable human suffering," the company said.

72.title: Kidambi loses, Lakshya enters semi-finals at German Open 2022
72.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen entered semi-finals of 2022 German Open after defeating compatriot HS Prannoy 21-15, 21-16 in men's singles quarter-finals on Friday at Westenergie Sporthalle. In other quarter-finals match, top-seeded Viktor Axelsen beat eighth-seeded Kidambi Srikanth of India 21-10, 23-21. Lakshya will now face Axelsen in semi-finals on Saturday.

73.title: Seized vehicles gutted as fire breaks out at K'taka police station
73.article_body: A fire broke out in the parking space of Kengeri Police Station in Karnataka's Bengaluru at around 1.30 pm on Friday, police said. "The compound wall adjoining [the] railway track also caught fire. Around 12 vehicles, involved in rioting, theft and robbery cases were damaged in the incident," DCP West Bengaluru, Sanjeev Patil, said. The fire was doused later.

74.title: 10-yr-old raped by father allowed to end pregnancy, HC says 'society must be ashamed'
74.article_body: The Kerala High Court has allowed the termination of the around 31-week-long pregnancy of a 10-year-old girl who was allegedly raped by her father. The petition was moved by the minor's mother. "If the allegation is correct, I am ashamed and of course, the entire society should bow their head for the same reason," said the High Court judge.

75.title: 36-yr-old Gabriel Boric sworn in as Chile's youngest President
75.article_body: Gabriel Boric was sworn in as Chile's youngest President on Friday, with delegations from the US, Spain, Argentina, Peru and others in attendance. Boric's female-majority Cabinet was also sworn in today. An economic slowdown, high inflation and a split legislature are among the challenges that the 36-year-old faces, according to Reuters.

76.title: NFT of clipart rock worth $1 million mistakenly sold by owner for under $0.1
76.article_body: A non-fungible token (NFT) of a clipart rock was sold for less than $0.1 after its owner mistakenly listed it for 444 wei instead of 444 ETH. "In one click my entire net worth of ~$1 million...gone," the owner tweeted, claiming that a bot "sniped" the NFT. Wei is the smallest denomination of Ether, the currency used on Ethereum network.

77.title: Fugitive accused of killing tigress, panther arrested in Rajasthan
77.article_body: A fugitive sought in cases related to wildlife offences was arrested from Rajasthan’s Dausa district by the CBI. The accused, who was absconding since 2008, had killed a male panther in Alwar in 2003 and a tigress in Sariska in 2004 and sold their skins for ₹1800 and ₹50,000 respectively, according to CBI. His accomplice was convicted in 2019.

78.title: Russia fired at Belarus from Ukrainian airspace to drag it into war: Ukraine
78.article_body: Ukraine's armed forces said that Russian aircraft fired at a Belarusian settlement near the border from Ukrainian air space on Friday to try to drag Belarus into Moscow's war on Ukraine. Ukraine said that Russian aircraft had taken off from an airfield in Belarus, crossed into Ukrainian airspace and then fired at the village of Kopani.

79.title: Cong will be reduced to small geographical area by 2026: Assam CM
79.article_body: Commenting on Congress' performance in five states that went to Assembly polls, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday said that the party will be reduced to a "small geographical area" by 2026. "People have rejected Congress as an alternative to...BJP," he added. "The party has now been limited to a level of a regional party," he further said.

80.title: 5 killed, 2 injured after car crashes into tree in Karnataka
80.article_body: Five people from Maharashtra were killed and two others were injured after the car they were travelling in crashed into a tree near a village in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district. The injured have been shifted to hospital, police said. The victims had been returning from the Dattatreya temple in Ganagapur when the incident took place, police added.

81.title: IPL franchise Gujarat Titans to launch team jersey on Sunday
81.article_body: Gujarat Titans, who will make their debut in IPL 2022, announced that they will be hosting their inaugural event on Sunday in which they will be launching the team jersey. Gujarat Titans squad will have a pre-season camp at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad before the start of IPL 2022.

82.title: New govt in Manipur will be formed before March 19: CM
82.article_body: Outgoing Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Friday said that the new government in Manipur will be formed before March 19 when the current state assembly term ends. Singh has resigned from the post and has been asked to continue as caretaker CM by Governor La Ganesan. The BJP won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur.

83.title: Bhopal prof, accused of sexually harassing girls, quits after ruckus
83.article_body: Professor Tapan R Mohanty of Bhopal's National Law Institute University resigned on Thursday amid allegations that he sent vulgar messages to female students. Several students had gheraoed his office demanding his resignation. "From the past two years, we conducted online classes so how can I harass them," Mohanty asked. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan ordered an inquiry into the matter.

84.title: What is the Most Favoured Nation status that US, allies want to revoke for Russia?
84.article_body: The World Trade Organization's 164 members commit to treating each other equally in order to benefit from the lowest tariffs, few trade barriers, among other things. This principle of non-discrimination is known as the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) treatment. By revoking Russia’s MFN status, Western allies can levy whatever import tariffs, quotas on Russian goods or even ban them.

85.title: Huma prepped for Gangubai Kathiawadi song at night amid Maharani shoot
85.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, who made a special appearance in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' in the song 'Shikayat', did the prepping and rehearsals for the song at night. She was busy during the day shooting for her web show 'Maharani' at the time. "I enjoyed the whole process and the vision Sanjay (Leela Bhansali) sir had for the song," Huma said.

86.title: Gave Shafali a break because she was out of form: Ramesh Powar
86.article_body: Ramesh Powar, coach of India women's cricket team, revealed the reason for dropping opening batter Shafali Verma in the World Cup match against New Zealand on Thursday. Powar said that Verma was "given a break since the opener was out of form". Left-handed batter Yastika Bhatia replaced her in the match, which India lost by 62 runs.

87.title: Direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3: Biden
87.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday said that "direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3". [It's] something we must strive to prevent," he added. "We'll defend every single inch of NATO territory. We'll not fight a war against Russia in Ukraine," said Biden. "Putin's war against Ukraine will never be a victory," he stated.

88.title: Russian shelling killed at least 1,582 in Ukraine's Mariupol: Report
88.article_body: City Council of Ukraine's Mariupol on Friday said at least 1,582 civilians were killed due to Russian shelling and a blockade which lasted for 12 days. This comes as several civilian facilities including a children's hospital were destroyed by Russian forces in Mariupol since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

89.title: Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of Punjab's people: Kejriwal
89.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that he's sure that Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of the people of Punjab as the CM of the state. Notably, Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann met Kejriwal in Delhi today, a day after AAP won Assembly elections in Punjab. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

90.title: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang says he will step down next March
90.article_body: China's Premier Li Keqiang on Friday said that he plans to step down after his current term expires next March. Li is number two in the hierarchy of ruling Communist Party's Politburo Standing Committee. Reportedly, President Xi Jinping is expected to secure a precedent-breaking third term as party chief at a party meeting to elect leaders for next five years.

91.title: Can't wait for tomorrow: Kohli shares net session pics ahead of 2nd Test
91.article_body: Ahead of India's second and final Test against Sri Lanka, Virat Kohli took to Twitter to share a few pictures from his practice session in Bengaluru. "Back to Bengaluru. Can't wait for tomorrow," he captioned the pictures. The ex-India captain recently played in his 100th Test in Mohali. He has scored 8,007 runs in Tests so far.

92.title: SP leader Yogesh Verma who guarded EVM room using binoculars loses
92.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Yogesh Verma, who was seen guarding an EVM room using binoculars, lost on Thursday from Hastinapur in UP. The seat was won by BJP's Dinesh by 7,312 votes. Notably, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav had levelled EVM tampering allegations and even said the machines were being transported without informing candidates. SP bagged 111 out of 403 Assembly seats.

93.title: Turkey moves its embassy from Kyiv to Chernivtsi: State media
93.article_body: Turkish Foreign Ministry spokesperson Tanju Bilgiç on Friday said Turkey has moved its embassy from Ukrainian capital Kyiv to Chernivtsi amid reports of a planned attack on the capital city by the Russian forces, reported state media. A country sharing maritime borders with Russia as well as Ukraine, Turkey was among the last countries to operate diplomatic missions in Ukraine.

94.title: US bans import of Russian vodka, seafood & diamond; downgrades Russia's trade status
94.article_body: US President Joe Biden announced on Friday that along with the European Union and the Group of Seven countries, the US will move to revoke "most favoured nation" trade status for Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. "We're also taking further steps, banning imports of goods from several signature sectors of Russian economy, including seafood, vodka and diamonds," he added.

95.title: Aaron Finch joins his 9th IPL team, replaces KKR's ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales
95.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has become the first cricketer to have been part of nine IPL teams. The 35-year-old has joined KKR for ₹1.5 crore as a replacement for their ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales, who has withdrawn from IPL 2022 due to bubble fatigue. Finch has played for RR, DC, PWI, SRH, MI, GL, PBKS and RCB in IPL.

96.title: Ukraine urges Israel to send military weapons and sanction Russia
96.article_body: Ukrainian ambassador to Israel, Yevgen Korniychuk on Friday urged Israel's government to enhance its support for Ukraine by sanctioning Russia and sending defence equipment. "What we expect from Israel at the moment... is to join the sanctions of their allies, including but not only the US and EU," he added. Kornyichuk also urged Israel to accept more refugees without limitations.

97.title: Plant 75 trees in each village to mark 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav': PM
97.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said that each village should create a small forest by planting 75 trees during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' to mark 75 years of India's Independence. There should be at least 75 farmers in each village who adopt natural way of farming, he added. PM Modi made the comments during his address at Gujarat Panchayat Mahasammelan in Ahmedabad.

98.title: Pakistan inducts made-in-China J-10C fighter jets to counter India's Rafale jets
98.article_body: Pakistan has formally inducted China-made multirole J-10C fighter jets into its air force. "Unfortunately, efforts are being made to create an imbalance in the region and to address this, a big addition has been made today to our defence system," Imran Khan said. Last year, Pakistan's Interior Minister said the jets were acquired to "counter India's purchase of Rafale aircraft".

99.title: Russian forces have caused $100 billion in damage so far: Ukrainian official
99.article_body: The invading Russian forces have so far cost damage of at least $100 billion to infrastructure and other physical assets, said Oleg Ustenko, economic advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. He added that the war has caused 50% of Ukrainian businesses to shut down completely, while the other half are operating well below their capacity.

100.title: 25-year-old man dies of alleged drug overdose in Punjab's Bathinda
100.article_body: A 25-year-old man died of an alleged drug overdose in Punjab’s Bathinda on Friday. The victim who worked in Rajasthan had allegedly arranged the drugs after returning to his village on Thursday, according to a Bhartiya Kisan Union-Ugrahan leader. The drug availability "is a serious challenge before the AAP government," the leader added while demanding immediate steps to control it.

101.title: Malinga named RR's fast bowling coach, Paddy Upton returns as 'Team Catalyst'
101.article_body: RR have appointed Lasith Malinga as their fast bowling coach ahead of IPL 2022. Malinga, who retired as a player in 2021, is the highest wicket-taker in IPL. "It's a wonderful feeling for me to return to IPL and an absolute honour to join RR," Malinga said. Further, Paddy Upton, who has worked for RR before, returns as 'Team Catalyst'.

102.title: 3 dead, 2 injured after truck hits parked vehicles on MP highway
102.article_body: Three people were killed and two injured after a truck collided with two parked vehicles, a tanker and a pick-up van, on Rewa-Prayagraj National Highway in Madhya Pradesh on Friday. The victims were pulled out of the vehicles with help of locals, police said. The injured were rushed to a hospital, while the bodies were sent for post-mortem, police added.

103.title: Jussie Smollett given 150 days in jail over staged hate crime case
103.article_body: Actor Jussie Smollett, who portrayed Jamal Lyon in drama series 'Empire', has been sentenced to 150 days in jail for staging a hate crime. Jussie had alleged that he was attacked by two men who yelled racist and homophobic slurs at him. He has also been ordered to pay $120,106 (₹91 lakh) in restitution and a $25,000 (₹19 lakh) fine.

104.title: Man hangs himself in TN after wife breaks phone suspecting affair
104.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Chennai after his wife broke his mobile while accusing him of having an affair with a woman. His wife, who had returned after spending six months at her native place, found him constantly messaging and speaking on phone, which led to an altercation, police said. She later found him hanging from ceiling.

105.title: Japanese schools ban ponytails fearing they might 'sexually excite' boys
105.article_body: Japanese schools have banned female students from wearing their hair in ponytails because the nape of their necks could "sexually excite" male students. "They are worried boys will look at girls," said a former middle school teacher. This is the same reasoning applied by schools while enforcing the white-only underwear rule for students, the ex-teacher said.

106.title: Singer Millind Gaba to marry longtime girlfriend on April 16
106.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba has revealed that he will be marrying his girlfriend of four years social media influencer Pria Beniwal on April 16. The festivities will begin on April 11 with the couple's sagan ceremony. The wedding is expected to be a traditional ceremony with Punjabi rituals along with  Haryanvi Jat rituals.

107.title: When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things: GT's Gurkeerat
107.article_body: On getting opportunity to play for Gujarat Titans in IPL 2022, batter Gurkeerat Mann said he's excited as the franchise showed faith in him. "When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things," he added. Gurkeerat was picked by Gujarat Titans for ₹50 lakh in mega auction 2022. He last played an IPL game in 2020 edition.

108.title: 27% winning candidates in Uttarakhand declared criminal cases: ADR
108.article_body: As per a report published by the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR), 27% of the 70 winning candidates in Uttarakhand Assembly polls have declared criminal cases against themselves. The report said 14% of winning candidates have declared serious criminal cases against themselves. Five of the 47 winning BJP candidates have reported serious criminal cases against themselves, the report showed.

109.title: Attack on Saudi oil refinery, Yemen's Houthis claim responsibility
109.article_body: Saudi Energy Ministry on Friday said an oil refinery in capital Riyadh was attacked by a drone on Thursday early morning causing no injuries. "The refinery's operations and supplies of petroleum and its derivatives were not affected," added the ministry. Meanwhile, Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for the attack. Three dones were fired at the oil refinery, Houthi spokesperson said.

110.title: My mom tried to leave Kyiv but decided to stay back & help: Dar Gai
110.article_body: Ukrainian filmmaker Dar Gai has said her mother had tried to leave Kyiv at one point but decided to stay back and help volunteers amid the Russian invasion. She added her uncle is also helping people in bomb shelters. "The war in Ukraine has been happening for the last eight years but now people are talking about it," she said.

111.title: Over 2.5 million people fled Ukraine since Russian invasion began: UN
111.article_body: UN's International Organization for Migration (IOM) on Friday said over 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since Russian invasion began on February 24. IOM spokesperson Paul Dillon said while over 1.5 million refugees escaped to Poland, the rest were third-country nationals. Meanwhile, UN said that it verified 516 civilian deaths and 908 injuries since the conflict started.

112.title: Putin fires 8 generals, is furious over losses in war: Report
112.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has sacked 8 generals and is furious at his intelligence officials over Moscow's losses in war, Ukraine's Defence Secretary Oleksiy Danilov claimed. He was quoted as saying by a Ukrainian newspaper that Russia has changed its tactics. The Russians never thought that Ukraine "is so united", said Danilov, adding that the road ahead "won't be easy".

113.title: Impossible for Congress to survive without Gandhis: DK Shivakumar
113.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Friday said it is impossible for Congress to stay united and survive without the Gandhi family. "They are key for the unity of the Congress party," he said. He made the remarks after Congress lost all five Assembly polls, triggering conversations about an introspection. "We...will always stand with the Gandhi family," he added.

114.title: What are chemical weapons that US fears Russia will use against Ukraine?
114.article_body: US has warned Russia may use chemical weapons against Ukraine. They are chemicals used to cause intentional death or harm through toxic properties, Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons stated. Munitions, devices and equipment designed to weaponise toxic chemicals are also chemical weapons. Type of chemical agents include choking agents, blister agents, blood agents, nerve agents.

115.title: I'll be 100% there: Warner on attending Shane Warne's state funeral
115.article_body: Australia opener David Warner said he'll be 100% there for legendary spinner Shane Warne's state funeral, set to take place on March 30th at Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). "It [news] still hasn't really sunk in. When we first found out, we thought it was a joke," he added. "It's definitely going to be extremely emotional for everyone," he further said.

116.title: Pregnant woman accused by Russia of faking injuries in Ukraine gives birth
116.article_body: A Ukrainian beauty blogger who was accused on Twitter by the Russian Embassy in the UK of faking her injuries after their bomb hit a maternity hospital has now given birth to a girl. Marianna Podgurskaya was pictured heavily pregnant with injuries to her face as she walked down a staircase while holding her belongings. Twitter had deleted Russia's tweets

117.title: BJP's victory is not a true reflection of people's mandate: Mamata
117.article_body: After BJP won Assembly polls in four states, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said the BJP's victory is not a true reflection of people's mandate. She said that if Congress wants then all anti-BJP parties can fight together in the 2024 General Elections. "Don't be aggressive for now, be positive...This winning will be a big loss for BJP," she added.

118.title: Court orders 'The Kashmir Files' not to show scenes on late squadron leader
118.article_body: A Jammu district court has passed an interim order restraining the makers of 'The Kashmir Files' from showing scenes depicting late Squadron Leader Ravi Khanna in the movie. This comes after his wife filed a suit alleging that the scenes showing him are factually incorrect and demeaning. The Vivek Agnihotri directorial is set to be released on March 11.

119.title: Byju Raveendran invests $400 million in BYJU'S as it raises $800 million
119.article_body: BYJU'S announced on Friday it has raised $800 million in a new funding round as the edtech startup prepares to file for an IPO. Its Co-founder and CEO Byju Raveendran has personally invested $400 million in the current round, which saw participation from Sumeru Ventures, Vitruvian Partners and BlackRock. BYJU'S is now valued at about $22 billion, as per reports.

120.title: He's Modi ji's son: J&K man thanks govt as son evacuated from Ukraine
120.article_body: A man from J&K thanked the Central government as his son was evacuated from war-torn Ukraine's Sumy and reached Delhi today under Operation Ganga. He said, "I want to say...it's [PM Narendra Modi ji's] son who has returned, not my son...We had no hopes given the circumstances in Sumy." "I'm thankful to...Government of India for evacuating my son," he added.

121.title: UP CM Adityanath tenders his resignation day after winning polls
121.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath tendered his resignation to Governor Anandiben Patel on Friday. BJP won 255 of the total 403 seats in UP, becoming the first ruling party to return to power in the state in 37 years. Before tendering his resignation, Adityanath chaired the last cabinet meeting of his first tenure as UP CM.

122.title: No security reasons to leave: Indian embassy in guidelines for students in Russia
122.article_body: Amid the war in Ukraine, the Indian embassy in guidelines for Indian students in Russia said that there are currently "no security reasons for them to leave". It, however, said that there are certain disruptions in banking services in Russia and direct flight connectivity to India and students concerned over these aspects may consider returning to India.

123.title: Zverev knows he was wrong, he recognised that very early: Nadal
123.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev's apology for lashing out at chair umpire in Acapulco last month, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said the world number three knows that he was wrong. "He recognised that very early...that's a positive thing," he added. Zverev was disqualified at Mexican Open for hitting umpire's chair with his racket many times following a doubles defeat.

124.title: Stellar explosion pushed particles close to cosmic speed limit: Study
124.article_body: A study published on Thursday said a massive explosion in a white dwarf star called nova accelerated particles close to cosmic speed limit. Scientists said gamma rays which were obtained from the shockwave were pushed close to theoretical speed limit which is near to the speed of light. The team used High Energy Stereoscopic System (HESS) to observe the explosion.

125.title: Dog floods kitchen by turning on tap in UK house, causes damage worth ₹4 lakh
125.article_body: A dog, which learnt how to turn on a kitchen tap, flooded the room of his owners' house in the UK, while they were out, causing them damage worth £4,000 (around ₹4 lakh). The incident was caught on the house's security camera which showed the dog standing on its hind legs to reach the tap at the kitchen sink.

126.title: Russian space agency head bars employees from leaving country: Report
126.article_body: Dmitry Rogozin, Head of Russian space agency Roscosmos prohibited agency employees from travelling abroad in order to curb brain drain, reported Kamil Galeev, a Moscow-based journalist. This comes as skilled professionals from IT, engineering, and hard sciences are leaving en masse, Galeev added. Reportedly, border guards are instructed to stop IT engineers, specialists from leaving the country.

127.title: Tina Ambani shares pics from son Anmol Ambani's wedding featuring Bachchan family
127.article_body: Businessman Anil Ambani's wife Tina Ambani took to Instagram on Friday to share pictures from the wedding of their son Anmol Ambani to Khrisha Shah. "A new chapter begins for Anmol and Khrisha with blessings from friends and family - the wedding," she wrote in the caption of the post. One of the photos features Amitabh Bachchan and his family.

128.title: Ex-Financial Services Secretary Debasish Panda appointed IRDAI Chairman
128.article_body: The government on Friday appointed Debasish Panda as Chairman of Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI). The appointment comes nearly 11 months after the post fell vacant following the completion of Subhash Chandra Khuntia's term in May last year. Panda is a 1987-batch IAS officer of the Uttar Pradesh cadre who retired as Financial Services Secretary this year.

129.title: Jailed Putin critic Navalny calls for anti-war protests across Russia
129.article_body: Jailed Russian President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny has called for more anti-war protests across Russia on Sunday. "Putin will most quickly be stopped by the people of Russia now if they oppose the war," Navalny said. Over 13,900 people have been detained at anti-war demonstrations in Russia since the start of the invasion, according to a protest monitoring group.

130.title: Putin's idea of blitzkrieg in Ukraine failed: Ex-Ukrainian Prez
130.article_body: Speaking on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko on Thursday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "understands that his idea of blitzkrieg has failed". He claimed that Ukraine's military and the unity of the Ukrainian people had slowed the Russian advance. "Please get out from Ukrainian soil...Please stop killing Ukrainians," Poroshenko added.

131.title: Russian forces used cluster bombs in Ukraine: UN human rights office
131.article_body: Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Friday said they have received credible reports of Russian forces using cluster munitions in populated areas in Ukraine. The office added indiscriminate use of such weapons is prohibited under international law. On February 28, Ukraine's rights groups had accused Russia of using cluster bombs during attacks on Ukrainian cities.

132.title: Drone apparently flying from Ukraine crashes in Croatia, none injured
132.article_body: Croatian authorities on Friday said a drone that apparently flew from Ukrainian war zone crashed in Croatian capital, Zagreb, creating a loud blast but no injuries. As per Croatia's National Security Council, a "pilotless military aircraft" entered the country's airspace from neighbouring Hungary. Meanwhile, Zagreb Mayor Tomislav Tomašević said initial findings suggested that it was an accident.

133.title: Kamala Harris laughs when asked about Ukrainian refugee crisis, criticised
133.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris, while addressing a press conference with Polish President Andrzej Duda, was asked by a journalist if the US was willing to make a "specific allocation for Ukrainian refugees". Harris broke into laughter before saying, "A friend in need is a friend indeed." The clip was widely circulated online with many criticising Harris for laughing.

134.title: Congrats erstwhile Lok Sabha benchmate Bhagwant: Tharoor on AAP's win
134.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor congratulated AAP leader Bhagwant Mann, who shared a bench with him in Lok Sabha, for winning Punjab. "Two pulmonologists and four eye surgeons among 13 doctors who are now AAP MLAs, the highest ever...Let's wish them luck," he tweeted. He also congratulated BJP for winning four states and added that Congress' convictions and values will prevail.

135.title: CEO rejects $100 mn offer for CB Insights, says 'never reply to Twitter DMs'
135.article_body: CB Insights' Indian-American CEO Anand Sanwal revealed he has declined a $100 million offer to acquire his market intelligence platform. Sharing screenshots of his conversation with the potential buyer, Sanwal tweeted, "A great reminder to never check or respond to Twitter DMs again." "You just missed the opportunity of a lifetime," the buyer told Sanwal after he rejected their offer.

136.title: It's like home venue for Kohli: Nikhil on pink-ball Test in Bengaluru
136.article_body: Referring to upcoming India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test in Bengaluru, ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said M Chinnaswamy Stadium is like a "home venue" for Virat Kohli as he has represented RCB many times here. "He has played more here in comparison to Delhi, [from] where he belongs. The way he's batting...can see him scoring that hundred pretty soon," he added.

137.title: Pune Int'l Film Festival concludes; Potra wins best Marathi Film award
137.article_body: The 20th edition of the Pune International Film Festival concluded at the National Film Archive of India on Thursday. While 'Potra' won the Best Marathi film title award, the Spanish film 'Between Two Dawns' won the Best International Film award in the Global Cinema Competition. "This year, we received...80 entries in...Marathi film competition category," PIFF Chairman Jabbar Patel said.

138.title: We sold ₹100 product for ₹5, it harmed Pakistani cricket: Rashid Latif on Rawalpindi Test
138.article_body: Talking about Rawalpindi Test between Australia and Pakistan which ended in a draw, ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said, "This series is about marketing our cricket." "I'd want a ₹100 product to be marketed as ₹150 product but in Rawalpindi...we sold a ₹100 product for ₹5 and it harmed our cricket," he added. ICC rated Rawalpindi pitch as 'below average'.

139.title: India issues statement after Indian missile lands in Pak, calls it 'accidental firing'
139.article_body: India has issued a statement after Pakistan claimed that an unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed on its soil on Wednesday. "In the course of a routine maintenance, a technical malfunction led to the accidental firing of a missile...It is learnt that the missile landed in an area of Pakistan...The incident is deeply regrettable," government said.

140.title: KTR inaugurates theme park, crematorium in Hyderabad's Uppal
140.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Friday inaugurated multiple new projects in Hyderabad's Uppal constituency including a theme park. The theme park at Uppal junction has been developed by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation at a cost of ₹2.17 crore. Rao also inaugurated a modern crematorium called Vaikuntadhamam and laid foundation stones for a sewage treatment plant and a flyover.

141.title: Man kills teen after he bumps into him on road in Thane, arrested
141.article_body: The Thane Police arrested a 24-year-old man, Siraj Ansari, for allegedly murdering an 18-year-old boy after he accidentally bumped into the former while walking on the road on Monday. Police said the accused thrashed the victim and smashed his head with a stone before dumping his body. Ansari was arrested and he confessed to the crime, police added.

142.title: Russia opens case against Meta for allowing users to 'call for murder' of Russians
142.article_body: After Meta Platforms allowed Facebook and Instagram users in some countries to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers over the Ukraine war, Russia said it’s opening a criminal case against Meta for "calling for the murder" of its citizens. Prosecutors also requested a Russian court to brand Meta as "extremist" and restrict access to Instagram in the country.

143.title: Woman once said 'You have big breasts, must have lot of sex': Sayantani
143.article_body: Television actress Sayantani Ghosh has revealed that a woman once told her that her breast size is on the higher side, adding that she must be having a lot of sex. "I don't even know what was that supposed to mean...I was a virgin then," the actress added. She further said that such things can unknowingly scar a person.

144.title: Hyd techie sent obscene pics & messages to women on Instagram, held
144.article_body: A 22-year-old techie has been arrested by Hyderabad Police for sending abusive messages and obscene photos to a woman through fake Instagram IDs. The accused, Talluri Krishna, was in the habit of creating such IDs and sending vulgar messages and photos to unknown women, police said, adding, he had once participated in a "nude video call" with an unknown person.

145.title: People raise 'Fadnavis go back' slogans on his visit to Pune; booked
145.article_body: Pune Police have booked 14 people for protesting and sloganeering against the BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis. The former Maharashtra CM, Fadnavis, was in Pimpri-Chinchwad for an inauguration ceremony at a wrestling centre on March 6 when the people raised slogans against him. The protesters raised slogans like "Fadnavis go back", "Corrupt Pimpri Chinchwad BJP", according to the police.

146.title: Psychologist's presence helping India Women a lot in WC: Head coach Powar
146.article_body: India Women head coach Ramesh Powar said presence of sports psychologist Dr Mugdha Bavare is helping the team in ongoing Women's World Cup. "The way Pooja Vastrakar and Sneh Rana addressed that [against Pakistan] collapse...is a part of mindset (and) that's what she works on," he added. Bavare is first psychologist to travel with Indian women's team on a tour.

147.title: Putin planning terrorist attack on Chernobyl nuclear plant, will blame us: Ukraine
147.article_body: Ukraine on Friday claimed that Russian President Vladimir Putin is planning a terrorist attack on Chernobyl nuclear power plant (CNPP). "A man-made catastrophe is planed at the CNPP controlled by Russian forces, for which the occupiers will try to shift responsibility to Ukraine," Defence intelligence of Ukraine tweeted. Earlier, Ukraine said Russia recruited 16,000 ex-ISIS fighters to fight them.

148.title: Mumbai's 2nd viewing deck expected to open by March-end
148.article_body: A second viewing deck is expected to open in Mumbai by March-end after one opened in Dadar last month. The new deck, a part of Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray's Tactical Urbanism concept, will be constructed on a stormwater outfall drain at Walkeshwar at a cost of ₹4 crore. It will offer views of Marine Drive and the Arabian Sea.

149.title: B'luru Police chief to address people's traffic grievances tomorrow
149.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday said that he will address people's traffic grievances tomorrow on 'Sanchara Samparka Divasa'. He tweeted, "I shall be available at MR Convention Hall, Mysore Road, Byatarayanapura Traffic Police Station limits from 11 AM to 1 PM this Saturday...to address traffic grievances." All traffic police officials will also meet the public, he further said.

150.title: Start of hovercraft service between Mumbai, Navi Mumbai delayed again
150.article_body: Plans to run hovercraft services between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai have been delayed again due to the Ukraine-Russia crisis. A Maharashtra Maritime Board (MMB) official said the private agency that was given a Letter of Intent in 2019 was to bring the hovercraft from Russia. The services were initially expected to begin in 2020 but were delayed due to COVID-19.

151.title: Bro sometimes lives below poverty line: Grimes on Musk not buying a new mattress
151.article_body: In an interview, Grimes remarked that the world’s richest man Elon Musk sometimes lives "below the poverty line". Speaking about when they had found a hole in her side of the mattress and Musk suggested that they bring over the mattress from her home instead, she said, "Like, bro wouldn't even get a new mattress…Bro doesn't live like a billionaire."

152.title: DS Patwalia resigns as Punjab's AG a day after poll results
152.article_body: Punjab Advocate-General Deepinder Singh Patwalia tendered his resignation on Friday, a day after Punjab election results confirmed that AAP would form the next government. "In view of the...constitutional convention, I hereby tender my resignation," he said. Patwalia was appointed in November 2021 after his predecessor APS Deol resigned. Deol's appointment was criticised by many within Congress.

153.title: There are certain positive shifts in talks with Ukraine: Putin
153.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to his Belarusian counterpart Alexander Lukashenko about talks with Ukraine amid war and told him, "There are certain positive shifts, negotiators on our side tell me." He added that talks continued "practically on a daily basis". Putin did not elaborate on the remarks, but said that he would go into more detail with Lukashenko.

154.title: Paytm Payments Bank stopped by RBI from onboarding new customers
154.article_body: RBI has directed Paytm Payments Bank Ltd to stop onboarding of new customers with immediate effect. "The bank has also been directed to appoint an IT audit firm to conduct a comprehensive System Audit of its IT system," an order read. "Onboarding of new customers...will be subject to specific permission granted by RBI after reviewing report of...IT auditors," it said.

155.title: Delhi-NCR gets its longest zipline in an army theme park at Manesar
155.article_body: Delhi-NCR region has got its longest zipline in an army theme park, Delta 105, in Manesar, a report stated. The zipline extends for around 224 metres and the starting point is 40-foot-high, making it the highest zipline in Delhi-NCR. It accommodates two people at one particular time. The park reportedly allows people to experience the training that soldiers go through.

156.title: Pratik Pota resigns as CEO of Jubilant FoodWorks to 'explore external opportunity'
156.article_body: Pratik Pota has resigned as the CEO and whole time director of Jubilant FoodWorks as he wished to pursue an external opportunity, the company informed in a filing to stock exchanges. The company added that Pota will continue in his current role till June 15, 2022. Credited for the company's turnaround, Pota had joined Jubilant FoodWorks in 2017.

157.title: Ukraine situation disconcerting, must support ceasefire talks: China
157.article_body: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang on Friday said the situation in Ukraine was disconcerting. During a news conference after the annual parliamentary session, Keqiang said it is important to support Russia and Ukraine in ceasefire talks. However, he refused to answer questions whether China would provide economic and financial support to Russia in face of sanctions by Western allies.

158.title: Turkish carrier stops flights to and from Russia for 2 weeks
158.article_body: Turkish airline Pegasus has suspended all flights to and from Russia for two weeks i.e. until March 27 amid financial sanctions imposed on Russia due to its military actions in Ukraine. In a statement, the airline said the company was forced to cease flight operations due to sanctions on insurance, leasing and other operations on flights to and from Russia

159.title: Russia recruited 16,000 ex-ISIS fighters to be used against Ukrainian civilians: Ukraine
159.article_body: Ukraine's presidential adviser Mikhail Podolyak tweeted on Friday that Russian officials, including minister Sergei Shoigu, have announced the hasty recruitment of 16,000 ex-ISIS fighters to be used against Ukrainian civilians. "Hiring ISIS and Russian propaganda claims about chemical weapons testify to an attempt to implement the 'Syrian scenario' in Ukraine," he added.

160.title: Green agriculture, conservation techniques employed in US farms: Govt
160.article_body: US Department of Agriculture (USDA) said farmers adopted conservation strategies to enhance climate-friendly agricultural practices across farms in the country. The findings released on Thursday found that farmers built buffers and wind breaks around fields to prevent soil erosion. The report added that farmers used conservation tillage techniques on over 210 million acres of farms nationwide.

161.title: Italy clears construction of 6 wind farms as part of renewables drive
161.article_body: Italian government has approved construction of six wind energy farms as part of its measures to spur the development of renewable energy. With a capacity of 418 megawatts, the parks will be developed in the regions of Puglia, Basilica and Sardinia. This comes as the government ramps up efforts to lessen reliance on Russian gas imports.

162.title: Global COVID toll may be 3 times the official toll, India saw 4mn deaths: Lancet
162.article_body: The number of people who died of COVID-19 worldwide could be more than three times the official toll of 5.9 million deaths (between January 2020 and December 2021), a study published in Lancet has said. It pegged the actual toll at 18.2 million and said that India saw 4.1 million COVID-19 deaths, accounting for 22% of the total global deaths.

163.title: China locks down city amid worst COVID outbreak in 2 yrs with 1,100 daily cases
163.article_body: China has locked down the northeastern city of Changchun, which has a population of around 90 lakh amid a new spike in COVID-19 cases attributed to the Omicron variant. China on Friday reported over 1,100 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily count in around two years. Out of the 1,100 new cases, 397 are local symptomatic cases.

164.title: Sharing stories of Warne has invigorated Australian team: Cummins
164.article_body: Australian Test captain Pat Cummins said his team is "still in disbelief" over the sudden death of legendary spinner Shane Warne on March 4. He added that after sharing various stories of Warne, "players are invigorated" to follow his blueprint in terms of playing to bring wins for team. "He's still one of our favourite ever cricketers," Cummins further said.

165.title: No player would want to sit out after that performance: Bumrah on Jadeja
165.article_body: Responding to a query about whether Ravindra Jadeja will be rested for India's second Test against Sri Lanka, Jasprit Bumrah said he doesn't think any player would want to sit out after a performance like Jadeja's. Jadeja scored 175* in the first innings of the Mohali Test followed by a nine-wicket haul. He was named Player of the Match.

166.title: Drug peddler arrested with 7 kg ganja worth ₹8 lakh in Bengaluru
166.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police arrested a drug peddler on Friday. The crime branch has also seized seven kilograms of ganja, which is estimated to be worth around ₹8 lakh, from the accused person's possession. It has also recovered ₹65,000 in cash and other items from the accused person, who is said to be from Odisha.

167.title: Steve Smith trolls himself over tweet on Australia's new debutant
167.article_body: Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith took to Twitter to congratulate leg-spinner Mitchell Swepson, who'll be making his Test debut against Pakistan. "It's been a while since a leg-spinner debuted for Australia in Tests. I have no doubt Swepson will be far more successful than the last leggie," he wrote. Notably, Smith had made his debut for Australia as a leg-spinner.

168.title: Appreciate the Pakistan batters instead of saying they played slow: Babar
168.article_body: Reacting to criticism over Pakistan's run rate in the opening Test against Australia, Babar Azam said the Pakistan batters should be appreciated adding that they did not bat slowly. "Abdullah Shafique [played]...his fourth Test and Imam-ul-Haq was making his comeback," stated Babar. Pakistan scored 476 runs in the first innings with Imam, Azhar Ali scoring 157, 185 respectively.

169.title: I was just too greedy: 'Jalsa' director on casting Vidya, Shefali
169.article_body: Director Suresh Triveni has said that he was just too greedy when he thought of bringing actresses Vidya Balan and Shefali Shah together for 'Jalsa'. He has previously worked with Vidya in 2017 film 'Tumhari Sulu'. "Working with [Vidya]...you want to go back to her with another film...And of course, I've been following Shefali's work for some time," Suresh said.

170.title: Against our values: Germany's Deutsche Bank refuses to cut off ties with Russia
170.article_body: Amid various brands suspending their operations in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, Germany’s largest bank Deutsche Bank refused to cut ties with Russia. Bank’s Chief Executive Christian Sewing said, "We are often asked why we aren't withdrawing completely from Russia. The answer is that this would go against our values." Sewing added, "We've clients who cannot exit Russia overnight."

171.title: Russian soldiers' bodies seen scattered on snow; Ukrainian says 'leaving them for dogs'
171.article_body: Dead bodies of several Russian soldiers have been seen lying in the snow near Kharkiv in Ukraine. When asked about what will be done about the bodies, one of the Ukrainian soldiers said, "What do you think will happen, we will leave them for the dogs." A soldier said that Ukrainians are fighting to protect their families and land.

172.title: Sachin told batters to attack Warne while leading Mumbai: Ex-coach
172.article_body: Ex-Indian fast bowler Balwinder Singh Sandhu who was Sachin Tendulkar's coach while he was representing Mumbai, said Sachin asked all the Mumbai players to "attack" late cricketer Shane Warne, during a three-day game against Australia. "The plan to attack Warne worked well as it not only benefited the Mumbai team but also the Indian team," added Balwinder.

173.title: Pune's Bharosa Cell resolved 1,675 family disputes in 2021: Report
