346.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram Stories to share that her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has crossed ₹100-crore mark at the domestic box office. She also shared pictures of herself having vegan burger to celebrate the milestone. "Happy century to Gangubai & happy vegan burger + fry to Alia...Thank you for all the love," she wrote.

347.title: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg offers to cover insurance for fired expecting parents
347.article_body: Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg said he'll pay insurance expenses for a group of expectant parents, who lost their jobs as the company fired around 3,000 US and India employees this week. The mortgage lending startup is offering extended medical benefits to 19 expecting parents, an internal communication said. Earlier, Garg was criticised for firing 900 employees on a Zoom call.

348.title: Hrithik, Deepika's 'Fighter' release postponed, film to release in Sep 2023
348.article_body: The makers of Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Fighter' have announced a new release date of the film. The action thriller, which was earlier supposed to release on January 26, 2023, will now hit the screens on September 28, 2023. In addition to Hrithik and Deepika, it'll also feature Anil Kapoor. 'Fighter' marks the first collaboration between Hrithik and Deepika.

349.title: Theft suspect kills self in Mumbai, family alleges police harassment
349.article_body: A 23-year-old man, suspected of stealing a bike, allegedly died by suicide at his residence in Mumbai's Dahisar on Wednesday. Victim Raj Pawar's family alleged he took the step after being harassed by the police a day before. "An enquiry has been set up under assistant commissioner of police to probe the grievance," zonal DCP Somnath Gharge said.

350.title: How does the Women's World Cup points table read after India's defeat?
350.article_body: Following India's defeat against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, hosts New Zealand jumped to second spot with four points from three matches and a net run-rate of +0.799. India are fifth with a win and a defeat in their first two matches. Australia are on top of the standings with four points and a net run-rate of +1.061.

351.title: Destroy disease-causing pathogens from labs: WHO to Ukraine
351.article_body:
The World Health Organization (WHO) said it has advised Ukraine to destroy "high-threat pathogens to prevent any potential spills" that would spread disease among the population. Biosecurity experts
said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine has raised the risk of an escape of disease-causing pathogens. The WHO didn't provide specifics about the pathogens or toxins housed in Ukraine's laboratories.

352.title: Man in US alerts police after watching burglar entering his Hyd home on CCTV
352.article_body: A Hyderabad resident living in the US prevented a burglary attempt at his home after he noticed an intruder and alerted the police. The house owner watched the CCTV footage of a burglar breaking into his house in KPHB colony, police said. He then alerted the neighbours who noticed the lock had been broken and the house bolted from inside.

353.title: 11-year-old accident victim gives new life to 4 in Chandigarh
353.article_body: An 11-year-old girl, Nayna Thakur, who was declared brain dead by doctors at PGIMER in Chandigarh after a fatal accident, has given new lives to four people. Her family donated her organs after which her kidneys were transplanted to matching receipts. Her corneas also helped two blind people restore their eyesight. Doctors have praised Nayna's family for their brave decision.

354.title: ACP booked, 3 aides arrested for assaulting family in Punjab's Ludhiana
354.article_body: An assistant commissioner of police (ACP) has been booked and three of his aides have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a family in a bid to grab their land in Punjab's Ludhiana. ACP, who was present at the spot at the time of the assault, fled. "ACP wanted to grab 600 square-yard plot for a long time," the complainant said.

355.title: Case against private resort owners in K'taka for encroaching forest land
355.article_body: A forest offence case (FOC) has been registered against the owners of a private resort for alleged encroachment of over five-acre land of Moorkannugudda forest in Karnataka's Sakleshpur. "The proprietors concerned say that they have bought the land from the revenue department. However, no revenue officer has any authority to grant forest land," a senior forest department official said.

356.title: At least 40 COVID patients overcharged at Gurugram hospitals last year
356.article_body: At least 40 COVID-19 patients were overcharged at Gurugram hospitals during the second wave of pandemic last year with bills going up to ₹31 lakh, the district administration said. These hospitals have been asked to refund the extra amount to the patients. The administration had received 65 complaints of overcharging at private hospitals including 10 major hospitals, an official confirmed.

357.title: Russia says pic of injured pregnant woman in Ukraine attack is 'fake', calls her 'actor'
357.article_body: The Russian Embassy in UK has tweeted that a viral picture of a pregnant woman injured during the Ukraine maternity hospital attack is "fake". The embassy said that the attack on the hospital in Mariupol was staged, alleging that the pregnant victim was an "actor". Twitter deleted the tweets from the embassy, saying they were in violation of rules.

358.title: West Bengal relaxes night curfew on Holi eve for Holika Dahan celebrations
358.article_body: The West Bengal government on Thursday announced that it would lift night curfew in the state on the night of 17 March, the day before Holi, to enable the celebration of 'Holika Dahan'. Restrictions relating to the movement of people and vehicles between 12 am and 5 am shall be relaxed, the state government said in an order.

359.title: India reports 4,194 COVID-19 cases, 255 deaths in last 24 hours
359.article_body: India has reported 4,194 new COVID-19 cases and 255 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,184 cases and 104 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 42,219, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,714.

360.title: First drone school inaugurated in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior
360.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia inaugurated the first "drone school" in Gwalior on Thursday. Chouhan said that this is the first of the five drone schools that have been planned in the state. He added that the use of drones will increase in the coming times and will create employment opportunities.

361.title: TikTok nears data-storage deal with Oracle for US users: Reports
361.article_body: TikTok is close to completing a deal with Oracle to store its US users' data, media reports said. Oracle had earlier discussed acquiring a minority stake in TikTok in 2020, when ByteDance faced pressure from the US government to sell the app. TikTok is also exploring partnerships with other technology companies over firewalls and cyber security measures.

362.title: Former FCI DGM, wife convicted of money laundering, get 3 years in jail
362.article_body: A Chennai court has convicted a former deputy general manager (DGM) of the Food Corporation of India (FCI), Dorai Raj and his wife, Sarumathi of money laundering, Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. The two convicts have been sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment. The court has also ordered for "immediate confiscation" of Sarumathi's attached property worth ₹81 lakh, ED added.

363.title: Thane petrol pump employee refuses to give man diesel in water bottle, attacked
363.article_body: A man attacked an employee of a petrol pump with a paver block on his head in Thane's Ulhasnagar after the latter refused to give diesel to him in a plastic bottle. Police are trying to trace the accused using CCTV footage. "The bottle's mouth was small. The nozzle of the petrol pump couldn't fit inside it," an officer said.

364.title: Centre giving 'stepmotherly' treatment to Maha: Awhad on Dharavi project
364.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of Housing Jitendra Awhad alleged that Centre is not paying attention to the Dharavi redevelopment plan even after the state government paid ₹800 crore for 45 acres of land. Why the Centre is giving a "stepmotherly" treatment to the state, Awhad said in the Assembly. Maharashtra government has written at least 10 letters to Centre, he further added.

365.title: 7 booked for trying to kill a 15-yr-old boy during fight in Pune
365.article_body: Pune police have booked seven persons for allegedly attempting to murder a 15-year-old boy during a fight between two groups in the Janata Vasahat slum area. The accused had reportedly attacked the victim and his friends with sickles and bamboo sticks, causing multiple injuries. The accused claimed that it was revenge for a sickle attack on the accused's friends.

366.title: Facebook allows posts seeking violence against 'Russian invaders' or Putin's death
366.article_body: Facebook parent Meta Platforms has temporarily eased rules to allow users in some countries to use violent speech like 'death to Russian invaders' in context of Ukraine's invasion, Reuters reported citing internal emails. "We still won't allow credible calls for violence against Russian civilians," a statement said. It's also allowing some posts that call for death to President Vladimir Putin.

367.title: PSG President threatens to kill Real Madrid staff member after CL defeat: Reports
367.article_body: After PSG's 2-3 aggregate loss to Real Madrid in Champions League round of 16, PSG President Nasser Al-Khelaifi went to referee's room and allegedly broke officiating equipment in anger. He also threatened to kill Real Madrid employee, who was recording the incident. Al-Khelaifi was reportedly unhappy about Karim Benzema's challenge on goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma in second-half of second leg.

368.title: S Africa asked to mediate in Russia-Ukraine conflict: Prez Ramaphosa
368.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that "based on its relations with Russia and as a member of BRICS", South Africa has been asked to mediate in the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Ramaphosa did not reveal who made the request. However, he added he has told Russian President Vladimir Putin in a phone call that the conflict should be settled through negotiations.

369.title: Auto-rickshaw driver, his 3 aides rob Pune passenger at knifepoint, booked
369.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver and his aides have been booked for allegedly robbing a 35-year-old passenger of his mobile phone and ₹500 at knifepoint in Pune. Police said the victim had boarded the auto-rickshaw near Khuda bridge during early morning. Three more people were present in the vehicle and the driver said that he would drop him in the Deccan area.

370.title: Top Russian commander who was awarded Order of Courage by Putin killed in Ukraine
370.article_body: A top Russian commander was killed by Ukrainian forces in an ambush on tanks that they forced into retreat outside Kyiv. Colonel Andrei Zakharov was awarded the Order of Courage by Russian President Vladimir Putin in 2016. At least five other Russian commanders have been killed since the invasion was launched two weeks ago, Ukraine has claimed.

371.title: 9 B'luru malls haven't paid ₹69 cr property tax to BBMP: K'taka CM
371.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that nine malls in Bengaluru haven't paid property tax worth a total of about ₹69 crore to the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Bommai said this while replying during the Question Hour in the state Legislative Council. According to the data provided by Bommai, Mantri Mall hasn't paid ₹20.33 crore property tax.

372.title: Man uses car with Delhi Police sticker for liquor smuggling, arrested
372.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested for smuggling liquor using a car with a Delhi Police sticker on its windscreen. Police laid a trap to arrest the man, a resident of Najafgarh, after receiving a tip-off. Police intercepted the car in the Shalimar Bagh area and found it was loaded with 24 boxes of illicit liquor, DCP (North-West) Usha Rangnani said.

373.title: 3 town planning schemes passed for Pune's Uruli Devachi, Phursungi
373.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved three town planning schemes' execution around the proposed Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority ring road. The schemes will come up at Uruli Devachi and Phursungi on 650 hectares of land. PMC Leader of House Ganesh Bidkar said it's a win-win situation as PMC will get land for free and landowners will receive developed land.

374.title: World's longest car with swimming pool, helipad breaks its own Guinness record
374.article_body: The world's longest car, a super-limousine, has broken its own Guinness World Record for previously being the longest car. First built in California in 1986 by car customiser Jay Ohrberg, 'The American Dream' originally measured 60 feet. Ohrberg later extended the limo to 100 feet. It includes a large waterbed, a swimming pool, jacuzzi, bathtub, mini-golf course and a helipad.

375.title: Delhi HC directs DMRC to pay ₹6,330 cr to Reliance's Airport Express Line
375.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to pay ₹6,330 crore to Reliance Infrastructure's Delhi Airport Metro Express Private Limited (DAMEPL) for an arbitration award passed in 2017. It asked DMRC to divert funds or raise loans to pay the amount to DAMEPL. DMRC is required to pay the amount in three installments by May 31.

376.title: Final results of UP Assembly election out; BJP wins 255 of 403 seats
376.article_body: The Election Commission has declared the final results of Uttar Pradesh Assembly election, with BJP winning 255 of 403 assembly seats in the state. While BJP will return to power in the state, Samajwadi Party secured 111 seats. Congress won two seats, BSP won one and Apna Dal (Soneylal) won 12 seats.

377.title: BJP wins 47 of 70 seats in Uttarakhand as EC declares final results
377.article_body: BJP will form the government for the second consecutive term in Uttarakhand after securing 47 of 70 seats in the state assembly election. According to the results declared by Election Commission, Congress won 19 assembly seats and BSP won two seats. Meanwhile, Independent candidates secured win over two seats in the state.

378.title: Japan to give ₹65,000 to foreign students in financial trouble: Report
378.article_body: Japan will give 100,000 yen (over ₹65,000) to support foreign exchange students who are facing financial trouble due to COVID-19, local media reported. The cash handout is reportedly aimed to aide people studying in Japanese universities, colleges and vocational schools. The move comes after Japan eased its entry requirements for visitors, including international students, earlier this month.

379.title: Incredibly lucky to be alive after beating cancer: Stanley Tucci
379.article_body: Actor Stanley Tucci has said he feels "incredibly lucky" after successfully fighting a battle with cancer. "They [doctors] couldn't do surgery because the tumour was so big. It's a miracle that it didn't metastasize," he said. The actor underwent a 35-day radiation treatment and seven sessions of chemotherapy, which affected his senses of taste and smell.

380.title: 700g marijuana, GOGO cigarettes recovered from drug peddler in MP
380.article_body: A 24-year-old drug peddler was arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Rajpur following a tip-off and 700 grams of marijuana and marijuana-filled GOGO cigarettes were recovered from him, police said. During interrogation, the peddler revealed he sold the 20 grams drug packets for ₹200 and GOGO cigarettes for ₹100. A case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act has been registered.

381.title: Canada's Ontario to lift mandatory mask rule on March 21
381.article_body: Canada's Ontario is set to lift its mandatory mask rule for most settings, including schools, from March 21 onwards, officials announced on Wednesday. "We're now learning to live with...COVID-19 for the long term...This necessitates a shift to a more balanced response," Ontario Chief Medical Officer of Health Dr Kieran Moore said. Ontario reported 2,125 COVID-19 cases on Thursday.

382.title: PMC beautifies 7,000 sq feet underutilised plot at Prem Nagar slums
382.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has transformed a 7,000 square feet street space into a public space at Prem Nagar slums. A member of the initiative said that the space had been underutilised before and mostly used for parking. "The initiative saw the light of the day with the support of MLA Sunil Kamble and PMC officials," he added.

383.title: Our needs are linked to both nations: PM on India's neutrality on Russia-Ukraine
383.article_body: Talking about the Russia-Ukraine war and India's neutral stance on the conflict, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "India's several needs are connected to these countries." He said that India has economic, security-related, education-related and political links with both Russia and Ukraine. India had earlier abstained from voting on a UNGA resolution against the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

384.title: No fast track exists for Ukraine's EU membership: Dutch PM
384.article_body: Speaking about Ukraine's application to join the European Union, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Thursday that there is no fast track procedure to become a member of the EU. Ukraine had applied for EU membership shortly after the Russian invasion. Rutte made the comment as he arrived at an EU summit at the Versailles Palace in France.

385.title: 100% crowd to be allowed for India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test in Bengaluru
385.article_body: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru will be allowed to have a 100% capacity crowd for the second India-Sri Lanka Test, confirmed Karnataka State Cricket Association (KSCA). Earlier, only 50% of the crowd was allowed due to COVID related restrictions. The second Test, beginning Saturday, will be a Day-Night Test. India lead the two-match series 1-0.

386.title: Man jailed for 8 yrs, fined ₹25,000 for sexually assaulting 13-yr-old
386.article_body: A man has been sentenced to eight years in jail for committing a sexual assault on a 13-year-old intellectually disabled girl in Mumbai in 2016. The accused who was aged 25 at the time had taken advantage of her, the special judge observed while refusing to show leniency in the matter. A ₹25,000 fine has also been imposed on him.

387.title: India is on the side of peace: PM Modi on Russia-Ukraine crisis
387.article_body: While giving a speech to party workers at BJP headquarters, PM Narendra Modi spoke about ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. "The ongoing war is affecting every country across the world. India is on side of peace and hopes that all problems are resolved with deliberations," he stated. PM Modi further said India's several needs are connected to the countries involved in war.

388.title: Nadal's start to 2022 season reminds me of Federer in 2017: Haas
388.article_body: Indian Wells tournament director Tommy Haas has said Rafael Nadal's 15-0 start to the 2022 season reminds him of Roger Federer's 2017 start (19-1), when the 20-time Grand Slam made a comeback from a knee surgery after six months. Nadal, who came back from a foot injury, has won Melbourne Summer Set, Australian Open and Mexican Open titles so far.

389.title: Let the American broomstick fly: SpaceX director on launch of Starlink satellites
389.article_body: SpaceX's launch director took a dig at Russian space agency's chief Dmitry Rogozin's recent remark during launch of Starlink satellites. "Time to let the American broomstick fly and hear the sounds of freedom," the director said as the rocket prepared to take off. Rogozin earlier said Americans could "fly on their broomsticks" after Russia stopped selling rocket engines to US.

390.title: 21-yr-old man found dead in open ground in Thane, probe launched
390.article_body: Police have launched a murder investigation after a 21-year-old jeans manufacturing unit worker was found dead in an open ground in Maharashtra's Thane last month. A post-mortem report has allegedly revealed that the victim, Sandeep Divakar, died due to strangulation. "We interrogated his brother and others to get details about...past rivalries...We're investigating from all angles," police said.

391.title: 2 held for their role in e-financial fraud on apps in Mumbai
391.article_body: The cyber-cell unit of Mira Bhayandar-Vasai Virar (MBVV) police has arrested two people, including a 50-year-old woman, for their alleged role in e-financial fraud on apps. This comes as a 26-year-old woman filed a complaint after availing instant loans amounting to ₹2.4 lakh by downloading such applications. A case under relevant sections of IPC and Information Technology Act was registered.

392.title: Don't know what to tell him, how to react: Ashwin on Rohit calling him 'all-time great'
392.article_body: Reacting to India captain Rohit Sharma terming him an "all-time great", Ravichandran Ashwin said, "I don't know what to tell Rohit. I am very bad at receiving compliments. I don't really know how to react." "Rohit went out into the press conference and lavished praise on me...At the breakfast hall I said that was very sweet of him," he added.

393.title: I think 'mankad' dismissal is unfair, I wouldn't consider it: Broad on rule change
393.article_body: After MCC removed 'mankading' dismissal from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out' section in rule book, England pacer Stuart Broad said, "Hasn't it always been a legitimate dismissal & whether it is unfair is subjective?" He added, "I think it's unfair & wouldn't consider it, as [in my opinion] dismissing a batter is about skill & the Mankad requires zero skill."

394.title: I congratulate AAP for Punjab win, I assure all possible support: PM Modi
394.article_body: After AAP won 92 of 117 seats in Punjab Assembly election, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "I would like to congratulate AAP for their victory in the Punjab elections. I assure all possible support from the Centre for Punjab's welfare." AAP's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said he'll take the oath of office in freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral village Khatkar Kalan.

395.title: Fish species bearing bright pink colour found in coral reefs of Maldives
395.article_body: A new fish species bearing bright pink colour has been found living in the deep reefs of the Maldives and Sri Lanka. The species have been named 'Cirrhilabrus finifenmaa', one of the first species to be named in Dhivehi, the language spoken in the Maldives. 'Finifenmaa' name was chosen because of its vibrant pink hue resembling a pink rose.

396.title: Must work closely with Bosnia to include it in EU: German minister
396.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Thursday said Germany and Bosnia-Herzegovina must work closely to include the Balkan nation in European Union (EU) amid Russia-Ukraine war. During a joint news conference with her Bosnian counterpart, Bisera Turković, Baerbock added that the Ukraine conflict was proof that more reconciliation between the Western Balkans and the EU was needed.

397.title: Japan Tobacco, the largest cigarette maker in Russia, suspends Russia investments
397.article_body:
Japan Tobacco Inc (JTI), the largest cigarette producer in Russia, has suspended all new investments and marketing activities in Russia effectively immediately following the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "The challenges of operating in Russia at this time
are unprecedented," the company said. JTI added it "cannot exclude the possibility of a
suspension of manufacturing operations in Russia".

398.title: India's cumulative COVID vaccination coverage nears 180 cr-mark
398.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Thursday said that the cumulative number of doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered in India rose to over 179.69 crore. More than 14 lakh doses of coronavirus vaccines were administered till 7 pm today, it added. Over 2.10 crore booster doses of COVID-19 vaccines have been administered so far, it further said.

399.title: Want a game where you can create 20 chances: Warner after Rawalpindi Test
399.article_body: Talking about the pitch condition in the drawn first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi, Australia opener David Warner said, "There wasn't any variable bounce, which you generally do see on worn wickets." He added, "I just want a game where you can actually create 20 chances. It's something that's going to be exciting and entertaining for the crowd."

400.title: Confident, aggressive Vastrakar is being seen in 2022 WC: Krishnamurthy
400.article_body: India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy said a different Pooja Vastrakar is being seen in ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. "A confident, aggressive, experienced Vastrakar...it was not only her death bowling but initially also when she came to bowl [against New Zealand], she looked very effective," she added. The India pacer registered bowling figures of 10-0-34-4 against New Zealand on Thursday.

401.title: B'luru minority college allows students in hijab to attend class
401.article_body: Mount Carmel College in Bengaluru has allowed pre-university students to attend class wearing the hijab along with uniform. This comes after the state government clarified to the Karnataka High Court that restrictions on religious attire won't apply to private, minority-run institutions. "We can comfortably wear hijabs now...teachers...pre-university department had no objections," a student said.

402.title: Final results of Manipur election out, BJP wins 32 of 60 seats
402.article_body: The BJP won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur while five seats were won by Congress, the final tally from Election Commission revealed on Thursday. The National People's Party, JD(U) and Naga People's Front won seven, six and five seats respectively. Two seats were won by the Kuki People's Alliance while independent candidates emerged victorious on three seats.

403.title: Food prices will rise globally: Putin on western sanctions on Russia amid war
403.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that western sanctions on Russia due to the Ukraine war could lead to an increase in global food prices. "Russia and Belarus are some of the biggest suppliers of mineral fertilisers. If they continue to create problems for...delivery of our goods, then prices will rise and this will affect the final...food products," said Putin.
